questions.question: Prompt engineering is:
questions.explanation: Prompt engineering is the art and science of crafting instructions that guide AI to produce desired outputs.

questions.question: The IDEAL prompt structure includes:
questions.explanation: IDEAL stands for Intent, Details, Examples, Architecture, and Limitations - a comprehensive prompt structure.

questions.question: Context in prompts helps AI:
questions.explanation: Context helps AI understand your project, existing patterns, and requirements, leading to more accurate code generation.

questions.question: Complex features should be:
questions.explanation: Breaking complex features into smaller steps helps AI handle tasks better and gives you more control.

questions.question: After generating code, you should:
questions.explanation: Always review and test generated code before using it to ensure it works correctly and meets requirements.

questions.question: Iterative refinement means:
questions.explanation: Iterative refinement means improving your prompts based on results to get better outputs.

questions.question: Why is context important in prompts?
questions.sampleAnswer: Context helps AI understand your project structure, existing patterns, conventions, and requirements. This leads to code that fits your project better and follows your established patterns.

questions.question: What are the benefits of breaking down complex features?
questions.sampleAnswer: Benefits include: AI handles smaller tasks better, you can review and refine each step, easier to debug issues, and more control over the generation process.

questions.question: What should you check when reviewing generated code?
questions.sampleAnswer: Check: functionality (does it work?), code quality (follows conventions?), integration (works with existing code?), security (no sensitive data exposed?), and whether it meets requirements.

questions.question: Explain the iterative refinement cycle.
questions.sampleAnswer: Start with initial prompt, add details, add style requirements, add technical details, then refine based on output. Each iteration improves the prompt and resulting code.
